questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Office 365 subscription that contains a user named User1.
You need to ensure that User1 can view Analytics & reports in the Microsoft Teams admin center. The solution must use the principle of least privilege.
Which role should you assign to User1?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Reports Reader
Users with this role can view usage reporting data and the reports dashboard in Microsoft 365 admin center and the adoption context pack in Fabric and Power BI. A user assigned to the Reports Reader role can access only relevant usage and adoption metrics. They don't have any admin permissions to configure settings or access the product-specific admin centers like Exchange.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#reports-reader

How to access the reports
To access the reports, you must be assigned one of the following roles:
Teams or Skype for Business administrator. (might be deprecated)
Global reader (only tenant-level aggregate and no per-user or team data).
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-analytics-and-reports/teams-reporting-reference#how-to-access-the-reports

Selected Answer: A
difficult to say what the right answer is. The aim of the question is, you need to ensure that user1 can view Analytics and Reports.

Global Reader has access to the Teams Admin Center and can see Analytics and Reports with the sub-items Usage Reports and Call Quality Dashboards.

Teams Communication support specialist also has access to the Teams Admin Center and also sees Analytics and Reports, but only with the sub-item Call Quality Dashboards.

Regarding least privilege and that we only know that he should read Analytics and Reports I would say Teams Communication support specialist. But that is interpretation as the question is imprecise.

Selected Answer: C
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-analytics-and-reports/teams-reporting-reference#how-to-access-the-reports
To access the reports, you must be assigned one of the following roles:

Global administrator.
Teams or Skype for Business administrator.
Global reader (only tenant-level aggregate and no per-user or team data).

Selected Answer: C
as per docs should be Global Reader: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-US/microsoftteams/teams-analytics-and-reports/teams-reporting-reference?WT.mc_id=TeamsAdminCenterCSH#:~:text=and%20communication%20efforts.-,How%20to%20access%20the%20reports,only%20tenant%2Dlevel%20aggregate%20and%20no%20per%2Duser%20or%20team%20data).,-To%20learn%20more

Selected Answer: A
To ensure that User1 can view Analytics & reports in the Microsoft Teams admin center while following the principle of least privilege, you should assign the role of "Teams Communication support specialist" to User1. This role provides the necessary permissions to access and manage Teams communication features without granting excessive administrative privileges.

Selected Answer: A
You have a Microsoft Office 365 subscription that contains a user named User1.
You need to ensure that User1 can view Analytics & reports in the Microsoft Teams admin center. The solution must use the principle of least privilege.
Which role should you assign to User1?
A. Teams Communication support specialist
B. Skype for Business administrator Most Voted
C. Global reader Most Voted
D. Global administrator

Global reader (only tenant-level aggregate and no per-user or team data)
The question asks for user1's data. so the answer is b

Selected Answer: C
is the correct C

comments.content:
I'm not sure: 

"Teams admin center - Global Reader cannot read Teams lifecycle, Analytics & reports, IP phone device management, and App catalog. For more information, see Use Microsoft Teams administrator roles to manage Teams."

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/roles/permissions-reference#global-reader

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. Global reader.

To ensure that User1 can view Analytics & reports in the Microsoft Teams admin center with the principle of least privilege, you should assign the Global reader role to User1. The Global reader role is a read-only role that allows users to view all settings and reports in the Microsoft Teams admin center, but does not allow them to make any changes.

Selected Answer: C
C - Global reader. Question states "view", which global reader role can accomplish. To add, there is no specific mention of tenant view or per-user view needed. So, going by the least principle aspect, Global reader fulfills the requirements of the question in hand. had the question been more specific, then i would change to Teams Admin.

comments.content: Reader, reader is least privileged and since the question did not specified that it needed more than "only tenant-level aggregate" and was no mention of "per-user or team data", Global reader should be correct

discussion.content:
To access the reports, you must be assigned one of the following roles:

Global administrator.
Teams or Skype for Business administrator.
Global reader (only tenant-level aggregate and no per-user or team data).
To learn more about Teams admin roles and which reports each admin role can access, see Use Teams administrator roles to manage Teams.

Go to the Microsoft Teams admin center, in the left navigation, select Analytics & reports, and then under View Reports, choose the report you want to run.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-analytics-and-reports/teams-reporting-reference 
so which one is least previlege?

Selected Answer: B
B. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/get-started-with-teams-monitor-usage-and-feedback#teams-analytics--reports-microsoft-teams-admin-center

Selected Answer: B

Teams admin center - Global Reader cannot read Teams lifecycle, Analytics & reports, IP phone device management, and App catalog. For more information, see Use Microsoft Teams administrator roles to manage Teams.

reference 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/roles/permissions-reference#global-reader

"To view these reports, you must be a global admin in Microsoft 365 or Office 365, Teams service admin, or Skype for Business admin. "

discussion.content: But with those cmdlets you CANNOT prevent guests from inviting other guests, so it's B.

This can be done using PowerShell and the B2BManagementPolicy available from Microsoft. This is just PowerShell to change the settings in AzureAD.
https://www.petri.com/azure-active-directory-external-collaboration-policy

correct answer is B

B
A cmdlet Set-AzureADMSAuthorizationPolicy is going to be helpful,
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/enterprise-users/users-restrict-guest-permissions#set-command-set-azureadmsauthorizationpolicy
External collaboration settings in Azure AD has the necessary settings to meet both requirements. The powershell commands do not meet the requirements.

discussion.content: If any one wants contribution access questions please text me on +91 8143123863
B is correct because with the PowerShell cmdlet you can only configure the allow or deny list AND you can't configure with the cmdlet to prevent guests from inviting other guests.

B is correct. Why: With the PowerShell cmdlet (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/external-identities/allow-deny-list#set-the-allow-or-deny-list-policy-using-powershell) you can only configure the allow or deny list AND you can't configure with the cmdlet to prevent guests from inviting other guests.
only de allow list can be managed by Powershell

Not sure about the PowerShell cmdlets. It is just available in the preview (https://docs.microsoft.com/de-de/azure/active-directory/external-identities/allow-deny-list), so I can't imagine that this is the right answer. BTW it can set the allowed and the denied domains, but not that guests are not allowed to invite other guests.
So I think correct answer is still B.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You plan to configure the environment to allow external users to collaborate in Microsoft Teams by using guest access.
The company implements a new security policy that has the following requirements:
✑ Only guest users from specific domains must be allowed to connect to collaborate by using Microsoft Teams.
✑ Guest users must be prevented from inviting other guests.
You need to recommend a solution to meet the security policy requirements.
Solution: From PowerShell, you run the New-AzureADPolicy and Set-AzureADPolicy cmdlets.
Does this meet the goal?

choices.B: From the Azure Active Directory admin center, configure Microsoft 365 Groups expiration.
choices.D: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the team's policy.
choices.C: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, modify the Office 365 group settings.
choices.A: From the Microsoft 365 compliance center, create a retention policy.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer is correct!

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/solutions/microsoft-365-groups-expiration-policy?view=o365-worldwide

The answer is correct but the link is kinda misleading. This explains it more clearly: " An administrator will have to enable the expiration policy and set the properties for it to take effect. To enable it, go to Azure Active Directory > Groups > Expiration."

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-US/microsoftteams/network-planner

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Microsoft Teams.
All the teams used by the company's legal department must meet the following compliance requirements:
✑ Each team must expire 365 days after it is created.
✑ All team content must be deleted when the team expires.
✑ An administrator must be able to restore deleted team content for 30 days.
What should you do?

discussion.content: On Exam Feb 2023

Selected Answer: AD
Right from the Microsoft Learn module for MS-700 course "Plan for Teams licensing":
Communication Credits provide a monthly pool of minutes that can also be used for PSTN phone calls, if all your Calling Plan minutes get used before the beginning of the next month.

If you want toll-free numbers for Audio Conferencing, auto attendants, or call queues, you'll need to set up Communications Credits.

Selected Answer: AD
A and D.

A&D
If you want to use toll-free numbers with Microsoft Teams, you need to set up Communications Credits. Microsoft recommends that you set up Communications Credits for your Microsoft Teams Calling Plan (Domestic, International, or Pay-As-You-Go) and Audio Conferencing users who need to dial out to any destination. Some destinations may not be included in your Calling Plans or Audio Conferencing subscriptions.

From: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-communications-credits-for-your-organization
A & D. It says toll free so you will need communications credit. Virtual user licenses are for resource accounts

Selected Answer: BD
Previously, a Teams Phone Resource Account license (once known as a Virtual user license) was only required when assigning a phone number to a resource account. Now, all resource accounts must be assigned a Teams Phone Resource Account license, regardless of whether they'll be assigned a phone number or not. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-add-on-licensing/virtual-user

comments.content: Microsoft 365 Phone System - Virtual User license is now the resource account - it's only used for auto attendants and call queues. It doesn't apply to this scenario.

discussion.content:
A & D

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-audio-conferencing-in-teams

Step 2: Get and assign licenses
For Audio Conferencing, you need a license for each user who will set up dial-in meetings. To learn which licenses you need to buy for Audio Conferencing and how much they will cost, see Microsoft Teams add-on licensing.

 Note

Audio Conferencing is included in Office 365 Enterprise E5 licenses and as an add-on.

After you buy the Audio Conferencing licenses, you will need to assign them to those people in your organization who are going to schedule or lead meetings. See Assign licenses to users in Microsoft 365 or Office 365 for business you purchased to the people in your organization who are going to schedule or lead meetings.

We also recommend that you assign Communications Credits licenses (they don’t cost anything) to the same people you assigned licenses to in the previous step. To learn how to set up Communications Credits, see Set up Communications Credits for your organization.

comments.content:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-add-on-licensing/microsoft-teams-add-on-licensing
"If you want toll-free numbers for Audio Conferencing, auto attendants, or call queues, you'll need to set up Communications Credits."
Microsoft 365 Phone System - Virtual User license is now the resource account - it's only used for auto attendants and call queues. It doesn't apply to this scenario.
The question is not asking about hypothetical outgoing calls...the question is what is the bare minimum to accomplish being able to call a toll free number. IMHO I think it is B&D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
"A" and "D" seems correct in that case. With "Audio Conferencing" you are able to dial in to conference numbers, but even it is toll free here you should assign "Communication Credits" so that outgoing calls can be paid by the pool of credits.

comments.content: "Virtual User" is a license for ressource accounts (call queues / auto attendants) and not for end users.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B&D 
Audio conferencing is needed to allow Toll free

Selected Answer: BD
"Toll Free", you do not need credits
Microsoft 365 Phone System - Virtual User & Audio Conferencing

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams. All users are assigned Microsoft Office 365 Enterprise E3 license.
You need to ensure that the users can join scheduled meetings by dialing a toll-free phone number.
Which two add-on licenses should you assign to the users? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
